lead_paragraph: VERDY--Violette. The School of American Ballet mourns the loss of a beloved family member. Having served as principal guest teacher since 2007, Violette's bond with SAB extends to the 1950s, when as a glamorous star of New York City Ballet she frequently took classes and guest taught at the direction of George Balanchine. She was instrumental to the launching of SAB's national recruiting program in partnership with the Ford Foundation in the 1960s and 1970s, traveling thousands of miles on the School's behalf to discover talented future dancers nationwide. Our students and all who encountered Violette were touched by her extraordinary generosity of spirit and joyful willingness to share her special gifts. She will be missed enormously. 1/3
